name: Dal Makhani
history: Dal Makhani is a popular dish from the Punjab region of India. It's a rich, creamy lentil dish, traditionally cooked slowly for a unique flavor.
description: Dal Makhani is a creamy and buttery lentil curry made from whole black lentils and kidney beans. It is simmered with spices, tomato puree, cream, and butter for a rich and hearty dish.

instructions.title: Soak and Cook Lentils
instructions.description: Soak urad dal and kidney beans overnight. Drain and cook in a pressure cooker until soft and mushy.

instructions.title: Prepare the Masala
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter. Add onions and cook until golden. Stir in ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the masala leaves oil.

instructions.title: Simmer the Lentils
instructions.description: Add the cooked lentils to the masala. Add water to adjust the consistency. Simmer on low heat for an hour, stirring occasionally.

instructions.title: Finish with Cream and Butter
instructions.description: Stir in cream and butter. Cook for another 10 minutes.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or naan.

tips: Ensure the lentils are cooked well for a creamy texture.
Simmering the dal for a longer time enhances the flavors.
variations: Add kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves) for an additional flavor dimension.
Substitute cream with yogurt for a lighter version.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl, garnished with a dollop of butter on top.
Accompany with a side of sliced onions and lemon wedges.
